I'm only 99% certain, but the argument passed to the TestCase
constructor MUST be the name of the method that will be executed and
nothing else. If you pass an invalid name, the only solution to make it
work is to overwrite runTest. But in this situation, it's overkilling.

I reiterate my suggestion (in case it wasn't clear):

ParameterizedTestCase(param1, param2, ...) {
super("execute");
this.param1 = param1;
...
}

public void execute() {
... the test method ...
}

public String getName() {
return makeSuiteName(param1, param2, ...);
}

> * Build your test suite by looping over the set of parameters you need to pass.

a nice solution is to define the suite() method in the
ParametrizedTestCase file: Everything is in one single file.

> * Code your test methods normally.

in my suggestion, the method is "execute": it's just to point out that
the method must not start with "test".
